doc.field: Records of New Perspectives on Caribbean Studies: Toward the 21st Century and Prospects for Caribbean Basin Integration(Conference held at Hunter College, CUNY, August 28-September 1, 1984)
Records of New Perspectives on Caribbean Studies: Toward the 21st Century and Prospects for Caribbean Basin Integration(Conference held at Hunter College, CUNY, August 28-September 1, 1984)

.5 linear feet (1 box). Arranged chronologically. This series consists of a select number of manuscripts presented at the conference (see Series XI. Conference Manuscripts). Edited by Frank McGlynn, then Associate Professor of Anthropology at the University of Pittsburgh at Greensburg, the papers were included in a special issue entitled "The Social Anthropology of the Contemporary Caribbean" published by the journal Third World Studies. Additional highlights in this series include a draft tribute and partial list bibliographic publications by Vera D. Rubin, written and compiled by Frank McGlynn for the preface (see Folder 1).
Records of New Perspectives on Caribbean Studies: Toward the 21st Century and Prospects for Caribbean Basin Integration(Conference held at Hunter College, CUNY, August 28-September 1, 1984)
